wikipedia_page.main: George Byng, 7th Viscount Torrington (9 September 1812 – 27 April 1884), was a British colonial administrator and courtier.

response: *George Byng, 7th Viscount Torrington (1812–1884), British colonial administrator and courtier

link_mentions.page: Lords and Gentlemen of the Bedchamber

response: **George Byng, 7th Viscount Torrington (1812–1884), eldest son and heir, a British diplomat who served as Governor of Ceylon between 1847 and 1850.

In 1884 he succeeded his uncle George Byng, 7th Viscount Torrington (1812-1884) in the viscountcy. In 1888 his uncle's companion, Andalusia Molesworth died. She left her fortune to Byng as she was estranged from her ex-husband's family.
